summary: An FBI internal email forwarding a lead from the National Threat Operations Center (NTOC). The lead contains a tip from an anonymous caller regarding Leslie McMichael, a former personal assistant to Jeffrey Epstein from 1986-1991/92. The caller reports McMichael's knowledge of Epstein's island purchase, party bookings, and her claims about guests and Epstein's wife. The document notes McMichael's fear of reporting to law enforcement.

persons.name: Leslie McMichael
persons.role: Former personal assistant to Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Reported by an anonymous caller to have been Jeffrey Epstein's personal assistant from 1986 to approximately 1991/92 while he was in Florida. She allegedly booked parties for his island and yacht, ran errands, and stopped working when she realized the young girls around him were not his nieces.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the FBI lead. His former assistant, Leslie McMichael, reportedly worked for him, booked parties for his island and yacht, and expressed regret over her involvement.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned by the anonymous caller as one of the guests named by Leslie McMichael as having attended Epstein's parties.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned by the anonymous caller as one of the guests named by Leslie McMichael as having attended Epstein's parties.

persons.name: Heather Straton
persons.context: Identified by the anonymous caller as someone who may have more information about Leslie McMichael's time working for Jeffrey Epstein, as McMichael had reportedly spoken to her about it.

connections.description: McMichael was Epstein's personal assistant from 1986 to approximately 1991/92, handling party bookings, errands, and miscellaneous tasks.
McMichael was reportedly friends with Epstein's wife, who she claimed 'helped to train the girls.'
McMichael reportedly talked to Straton on different occasions about her time working for Jeffrey Epstein.
McMichael reportedly named Clinton as a guest at Epstein's parties.
McMichael reportedly named Trump as a guest at Epstein's parties.

events.title: FBI NTOC receives tip on Epstein
events.description: An anonymous caller contacts the FBI National Threat Operations Center to report information about Jeffrey Epstein and his former assistant, Leslie McMichael.

events.title: McMichael's employment with Epstein
events.description: Leslie McMichael reportedly worked as Jeffrey Epstein's personal assistant during this period, booking parties for his island and yacht and running errands.

locations: M (mentioned as a location for a LexisNexis query for McMichael)
keyFacts: Leslie McMichael, a former personal assistant to Jeffrey Epstein from 1986-1991/92, reportedly booked all parties for Epstein's island and yacht and was present when he purchased the island.

McMichael stopped working for Epstein when she 'figured out that all of the little girls he had around weren't his nieces' and expressed deep regret and fear of reporting to law enforcement due to potential repercussions.
McMichael reportedly named Bill Clinton and Donald Trump as guests at Epstein's parties and claimed Epstein's wife 'helped to train the girls.'
McMichael was allegedly paid 'under the table' by Epstein, leading her to believe there is no official record of her employment.
The FBI lead was generated from an anonymous tip to the National Threat Operations Center in July 2019, indicating ongoing public interest and investigation following Epstein's arrest.
